qas.question: What is an Islamic revival movement?
What aspects of life does Islamism seek to integrate itself into?
What goal does Islamism have when it comes to society and government?

answers.text: reordering of government and society in accordance with the Shari'a

qas.question: What have the two different Islamist movements been described as oscillating between?
One strategy of Islamization is to seize power by what methods?
What is a non-Islamic revival movement?
What aspects of life does Islamism not seek to integrate itself into?
What goal does Islamism not have when it comes to society and government?
One strategy of Islamization is to not seize power by what methods?

context: <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><b5_0>Islamism<b5_0/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>, also known as Political Islam (Arabic: إسلام سياسي‎ islām siyāsī), is an Islamic revival movement often characterized by moral conservatism, literalism, and the attempt "to implement Islamic values in <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><b6_0>all spheres<a1_2/> of life<b6_0/><a1_1/>.<a1_0/>" Islamism favors the <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><b7_0>reordering<b7_0/><a2_2/><a2_0/> of government and society in accordance with the Shari'a<a2_1/>. The different Islamist movements have been described as "oscillating between <a3_1>two <a3_0><a3_2>poles<a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>": at one end is a strategy of Islamization of society through state power seized by <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><b8_0>revolution<a4_2/> or invasion<b8_0/><a4_1/><a4_0/>; at the other "reformist" pole Islamists work to Islamize society gradually "from the bottom up". The movements have "arguably altered the Middle East more than any trend since the modern states gained independence", redefining "politics and even borders" according to one journalist (Robin Wright).
